result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Thomas D Harris

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Thomas D Harris not in court, in custody.  Attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris appeared by video for Thomas D Harris. Attorney William R.F. Ackell appeared in person for Attorney Stephan Eduard Nolten in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Court waived appearance. Case is calendared for a Scheduling Conference.
Defense received discovery and offer. Defendant has a pending revocation proceeding and needs time to go over offer with client.
Court order matter adjourn back in Branch 19 by zoom.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 30, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Thomas D Harris appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris appeared by video for Thomas D Harris.   Abby Rockendorf in court, appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 19, Judge K. Ashley. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 19.
Scheduling conference scheduled for September 20, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.
  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
  No possession of any controlled substance without a valid prescription.

Defendant Thomas D Harris in court with attorney Joan Elizabeth Zawikowski.  Defendant Thomas D Harris in custody.  Erin Michelle Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   All parties appeared by video conference.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Ashley, Branch 19.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 24, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
